title: Inverse Trig Functions - setting up a ratio

content.question: ​The figure gives a right triangle, where <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the length of the side opposite angle <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. If the function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives values of <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> as a function of <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, which of the following could define <math alttext="f open parentheses y close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>y</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="f open parentheses y close parentheses equals cos open parentheses y over 12 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>y</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mn>12</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="f open parentheses y close parentheses equals sin open parentheses y over 12 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>y</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mn>12</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="f open parentheses y close parentheses equals cos to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses y over 12 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>y</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mn>12</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="f open parentheses y close parentheses equals sin to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses y over 12 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>y</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mn>12</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="f open parentheses y close parentheses equals sin to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses y over 12 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>y</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mn>12</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
